items.title: Usage suggestion
items.body:
First of all thanks for publishing this work around, the slowness of the entrypoints was driving me crazy 😄 

I'm currently integrating it in my `setup.py` simply as follows:

```py
try:
    import fastentrypoints
except ImportError:
    from setuptools.command import easy_install
    import pkg_resources   # oh the irony :)
    easy_install.main(['fastentrypoints'])
    pkg_resources.require('fastentrypoints')
    import fastentrypoint
```

It avoids having to put `fastentrypoints.py` in the project and under normal circumstances it should have no problem installing it when required.

items.title: Can you put the license on top of the file?
items.body:
Hey,

- your license states that the license must be retained in all redistributions.
- you encourage to include the module into other projects as a single file

this would be easier if you add the license to the top of the module, so there is no need to worry whether one has to manually paste it there or whether one should put the script with its license file in a separate subdirectory or whatever :)

Best, and thanks for consideration,
Thomas

items.title: Fails with AttributeError on install
items.body:
Hi, thanks for writing this, great to see an attempt to do something about this problem!

I got an issue when trying to install on Travis:
```
running build_ext
Creating /home/travis/build/thusoy/remodep/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/remodep.egg-link (link to .)
Adding remodep 1.0.0 to easy-install.pth file
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/travis/build/thusoy/remodep/setup.py", line 50, in <module>
    'Programming Language :: Python :: 3.5',
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/core.py", line 152, in setup
    dist.run_commands()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 953, in run_commands
    self.run_command(cmd)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 972, in run_command
    cmd_obj.run()
  File "/home/travis/build/thusoy/remodep/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/develop.py", line 32, in run
    self.install_for_development()
  File "/home/travis/build/thusoy/remodep/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/develop.py", line 132, in install_for_development
    self.process_distribution(None, self.dist, not self.no_deps)
  File "/home/travis/build/thusoy/remodep/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 680, in process_distribution
    self.install_egg_scripts(dist)
  File "/home/travis/build/thusoy/remodep/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/develop.py", line 160, in install_egg_scripts
    self.install_wrapper_scripts(dist)
  File "/home/travis/build/thusoy/remodep/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 751, in install_wrapper_scripts
    for args in ScriptWriter.best().get_args(dist):
  File "fastentrypoints.py", line 29, in get_args
    cls._ensure_safe_name(name)
AttributeError: type object 'ScriptWriter' has no attribute '_ensure_safe_name'
```

The full output and attempted command is in [this repo](https://github.com/thusoy/remodep), it's very small and simple if you want to take a look if there's anything I've done wrong. It works with me locally, so I'm thinking it might be a pip/setuptools version issue? Have you tried running it on any CI yourself?
